Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Penny G
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. We stayed in room 19 which is a hugh room with a balcony. Our room was very clean and spacious. The bed was very comfortable. The decor is historic with the old world charm. Tall ceilings, French doors with shutters that lead to the balcony, wood floors, small refrigerator, and plenty of storage. Free continental breakfast with the best coffee in Puerto Rico! The front desk was very pleasant and gave us suggestions on places to eat, places to see, things to do. Taxis are outside the hotel door so transportation was not a problem and we did not have to rent a car. We asked for an extended time on check-out due to our departure time, this was not an issue and in fact they did not charge us for the extra time. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simple room, awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Travelman-Tx
Reviews.Content: First the strange news. We read the comments on TA and asked for a quiet room. I think we got the most quiet room one can get, in the middle of the building, with no windows. So OK, bizar, quiet, but also not for people with claustrophobia. The bed had known better times. The bathroom was small and the shower was far from perfect. So if you go for simple, with some surprises but clean, Belgica is OK. Also to mention, service level at the reception was super. We booked through Booking.com and a free breakfast was included. Problem is you could hardly call it breakfast. In the lobby on a small table were a thermos and a plate with 4 muffins. Needless to say we went out for breakfast, which we found in one of the souvenir shops on the square, just around the corner of the hotel. Still, the hotel being just around the corner f the main square in ponce, location is great. Stroll around in the streets and see great architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: nwhiteiii
Reviews.Content: My room was very clean and spacious and the decor was beautiful. The person on duty when I arrived was very friendly. She took me on a short tour of the hotel, showed me a couple of rooms and let me choose the one I wanted. I wound up choosing the room at the front of the hotel with the balcony. She did forewarn me of the noise at night but I didn't mind, I liked the idea of relaxing on the balcony reading a book or watching traffic go by. The hotel is located in the middle of the city and VERY short walk to the town center. There are a few bars, some restaurants, and a couple of fast food places (Burger King, Churches Fried Chicken) within walking distance (less than 3min). If walk a little further there is the shopping strip which has a variety of stores and an indoor/outdoor food court where you can get some very good local food. Overall I thought this was a great hotel and would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: wvanderwahl
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Belgica for a few days. I stayed in two rooms, first room number 16 and then in room number 4. I was upgraded due to a minor leak in the first room. The manager, Mr. Humberto Saavedra personally made sure I was satisfied and apologized, though there was no need for that as it was such a minor inconvenience. I thought the location was perfect, near everything. I even stumbled across a lovely antique shop on the same street, just ten feet away from the hotels entrance. Also, taxi cabs are parked just across the street if you need one. My stay wasn't nearly as long as I would have liked it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: jas55_10
Reviews.Content: This warren of stairs and buildings is wonderful. Lovely room with high ceilings and a shared balcony running along the street side. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Sometimes there isnt enough hot water and the street noises at night are very loud. They have earplugs at the front desk. Be warned - Its hard to find the center of town as the signs are not correct.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Sandy_baby2
Reviews.Content: This place was the best thing about our time in Ponce. BE WARNED - EVERYTHING in Ponce is closed Monday - Friday. Do not bother going there during the week. There is nothing to do and only two restaurants and about 2 bars open. The hotel was sooo lovely though. Very charming and quaint, clean and spacious rooms and real old world charm. We had a little balcony and the decor was really lovely, all dark wood shutters and a nice huge bed. We really just holed up in here and snuggled, and it made the whole trip worth it. Your not getting a standard hotel experience here - it's really unique. No elevator, converted 18th century Hacienda with hand-painted tile floors - and breakfast muffins and coffee in the lobby every morning. I would recommend them and stay again anytime..but will not visit Ponce again in a hurry, even though it's a pretty little town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KristaTheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel down town Ponce. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room is spacious, shower is hot and clean. Only down part was the noice. We were at the street side (front of hotel) and a lot of noice from the street comes into you room. Till 2AM the party goes on, at 4AM the city starts to live (trucks etc.). So ask for a room at the back of the hotel or ask for earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “A warm and welcoming place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CC L
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint and delightful place to stay for a night. The only reason I don't say more than 1 night is that there was little to do on the weekdays we were there (the art museum was closed, trolley tour was not running, and most nearby restaurants were closed in the evening.) The owner (I thought his name was Roberto but I now see it must be Humberto!) was extremely personable and welcoming - really he is an exceptional host. He went out of his way to help park our car, assist wtih bags, share some history and show us to a local restaurant that he obviously sends many guests to. The hotel is nicely decorated and comfortable as well as very clean. The rooms are spacious with plenty of places to put your things, everything was in working order and we were able to get a hair dryer from the desk. Other staff were friendly but had few recommendations to offer. Go across the street for a down to earth local breakfast experience. There were few dinner options - however, the Ramada outdoor courtyard was very decent and not what you might expect. There is also a fun place to get a frozen treat (King's creme I think it's called). The old section of Ponce was interesting to walk around, and you can imagine how beautiful it must have been. There are some lovely restored buildings, but sadly much of it is run down. Many vacancies and tacky shops - did not see any fine artisans that others mentioned; perhaps they are only there certain days.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly cool place for the price”
Reviews.Author: ltwau
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel with good updates in the rooms. The balcony room we had was large, with high ceilings and nice furnishings. The staff were friendly and helpful, and as others have said, the breakfast is pretty skimpy. The complaints about noise are valid, too. The nearby bar has a thumping bass until about 3 a.m., although that's not what kept me awake; instead, the car and foot traffic until 3 a.m. was the problem, with shouts and singing, as well as loud car stereos. It was all manageable with earplugs, though, so definitely bring them. (And this isn't the fault of the hotel.) Ponce is a really lovely little city, but many things were closed the weekend we were there, especially restaurants. We ended up eating in the Ramada our first night--not our first choice, but it was that or Burger King or Church's; everything else was closed on a Friday night. We had similar problems with breakfast and lunch all weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Super cute”
Reviews.Author: BetsyGT
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two nights ago, what a beautiful little hotel! The staff was very friendly too. Breakfast was very simplecontinental breakfast, but it got us the coffee we needed to get going which is what we cared about anyway...! Turns out we got the very last room left (they were sold out) and it was a comfortable, big, spacious room... with a nice balcony to the street: the noise went on until past 4am. Way too nosiy and did not get a good sleep at all. My parents had the room next door and did not hear all the raucous and slept very well. So stay away from the street rooms if you can help it! Also, be advised this is a gorgeaus but very old building, the rooms are on the 2nd floor and there is no elevator, so a handicapped person would have a hard time getting upstairs. The hotel location is great. We went walking around the plaza, just a few steps away, they had artisans displaying stunning wood carvings as well as sculpture clay art; very pretty and the artisans are also very knowledgeable and eager to answer any question you may have about their craft. They also had pretty and inexpensive hand made souvenirs; far from the "made in China" rubbish and a much more elegant gift. Right across we saw a long line of locals waiting to buy ice cream, so we decided to follow suit... And it was so worth it! Made on site every day, ice cream in all kinds of fruit flavors as well as vanilla and chocolate. Oh my goodness, we tried guanÃ¡bana, coco (coconut), parcha (passion fruit) and fresa (strawberry). They were all very tasty and delicious and wish I could have tried them all! LlimÃ³n (lime) and almendra (almond) were also recommended by locals.. And the prices were so cheap ($3 for two medium size cups with 2 flavors each) you almost feel guilty! (Just leave them a nice tip please :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yujiang
Reviews.Content: Big and comfortable room. Good location, close to every important attractions. Breakfast is too simple and is prepared in the hall, which is strange for such a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, nothing to do in Ponce.”
Reviews.Author: cleeamon
Reviews.Content: We heard so much about Ponce. However, there was not much to do at all; most of the restaurants were either abandoned or closed by 7pm; only option left was Burger King (and I am not a fast food fan!!). The hotel is an old victorian buliding and very cute! Rooms simple with a shared terrace that works great for quiet time. The internet was not working anywhere on property however. The hotel staff should be more updated on which restaurants are really open or closed...would have been very helpful! Ponce is very easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old style hotel but make sure you don't book a balcony room”
Reviews.Author: RP413
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just off the main plaza of ponce with some nice things to do within walking distance. However, Ponce doesn't exactly have that much going on. We used this hotel as a stopover for out trip around the island. I wouldn't recommend spending any more than a few hours in ponce to check out the square and the boardwalk. But back to the hotel - it was clean and the front desk lady was very helpful. Our main problem was the street noise that came into our balcony room. Since there are no glass windows, just wooden shutters, the noise comes straight through. I wore ear buds and still woke up multiple times in the night to cars and trucks driving by. If you plan to stay in ponce and want a nice hotel this is a good option just make sure to NOT book a balcony room.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent visitor to Hotel Belgica”
Reviews.Author: usmc1346
Reviews.Content: Ponce is my birthplace. My husband and I always stay at the hotel Belgica when we travel to Ponce. Our favorite room is #19. Clean and comfy bed, and the cute balcony facing the main street. The continental breakfast needs improvement. However, there are many little cafes to stop and have either a full breakfast and a quick "cafe con leche". The manager is very courteous and helpful. He even let us park our car in front of the hotel for the 2 nights we were there. The ladies at the front desk were very nice and were helpful in answering our questions regarding sightseeing tours, etc. Looking forward to staying at the Belgica on our next trip to Ponce.

Reviews.Title: “Nice architecture but worst night of our trip”
Reviews.Author: Arcee_CO
Reviews.Content: On our eight day trip to Puerto Rico, this one night stay was absolutely the low point. The online rate of $80 made this sound attractive, and the location seemed ideal - just steps from the city square and cathedral. The decor of the lobby and our room was very European and charming in a two century old building with a parquet tiled floor, mirrors, antique looking furniture -- BUT the noise on a Friday night caused by a nearby rum bar was horrific. It reminded us of torture by loud music! I was unable to sleep until I found my MP3 player in a suitcase with headphones. Still, the music noise did not ebb until after 4 a.m. It was compounded by cars cruising the street with music blasting at maximum volume. We spoke to the owner upon checkout. He said that the rum bar was open only on the weekends and was supposed to close at 2 a.m. but the police do not enforce this deadline consistently. Despite the fact we only slept for under three hours and had our night totally disrupted, the owner did not offer a refund of any amount on our room charge. As long as the rum bar is open nearby, DO NOT stay at this hotel on a weekend. They need high-tech super soundproofing if they want to stay in business.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: goldrush28
Reviews.Content: We travel to Puerto Rico regularly and stay in San Juan. We have heard many times that the Carnival preceding the end of Lent should not be missed. Going for the day meant a long trip back late at night so we decided to stay at the Hotel Belgica. The price could not have been more reasonable. The hotel could not have been more conveniently located (we could actually see the main stage and most of the festivities from our balcony). Although quite old and very quaint, the room was immaculate, as was the lobby and every part of the hotel we saw. Umberto and his wife were the perfect hosts, answering any and all questions we might have had. we will stay there again, probably for more than one night so as to enjoy the many things Ponce has to offer. We must say that the people in Ponce were as friendly as anywhere we have been on the island and there are not too many places we have not been to over the years. Stay there, I promise you will be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm in a Picturesque City”
Reviews.Author: csieuchand
Reviews.Content: Hotel Belgica is a beautiful hotel. It is a classic, old world building with interesting decor. The lobby is charming and curious. The staff was very friendly and Mr. Saavedra, the hotel manager (with whom I spoke several times via email) was helpful and professional. I stayed in room number 9 which had a balcony overlooking Villa Street. The room was lovely! The warm water was unfortunately inconsistent and this will trouble some travelers. The bed was very comfortable. There was a television. While there is wi-fi, it is not readily available in the rooms and you would more than likely have to go into the corridors to access it. The "computer room/gym" was quite warm, but it was nice to have internet access available. The room had a fridge, which I appreciated. The breakfast was not particularly good. It was a very minimal selection. The location of the hotel is amazing! It is right in the heart of Ponce! Ponce was a beautiful city and I thoroughly enjoyed it. It was so picturesque. The night life was not great, but the square is lit beautifully. I recommend the Lola restaurant at the nearby Ramada for dinner, but it was pricey. Hotel Belgica certainly did not disappoint me, but there are aspects that could be improved. By the way, the rates were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, staff problems”
Reviews.Author: msague
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Hotel Belgica because it's in the colonial area, it's a good value and is a historic building. We had a room with a balcony, which was very nice, but be advised that these rooms face the street so especially in the morning they can be noisy due to the activity on the street. We were happy with our room. It was comfortable and clean. I would stay there again. Our problem was with the staff. We were driving to Ponce at night and called the hotel 6 times to get directions once we were in town. Finally, a woman answered and gave us only part of the directions! She said that when we got to a certain place to call her back again. Well, of course, when we tried to call her to get the rest of the directions, we got no answer. Thank God I knew the name of the main square in Ponce and was able to ask a good samaritan how to get there. (the hotel is half a block away from the square). The breakfast they include is continental. Some muffins, coffee, juice. I recommend you go into Burger King a block away, on the square, and try a Puerto Rican mayorca, a delicious bread made in PR. Have it with butter or with ham and cheese, . Yes, BK has them. If you want something heartier, there is a cafe on calle Cristina, the street where the Hotel Melia is. The cafe is diagonal to the Music School.... it has the word "fruit" in it's name.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel, ever.”
Reviews.Author: gypsypermit
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It is like a step back in time, only better. The rooms are good-sized with tons of original touches. They did a good job retaining the character of the building. The newer additions are either unobtrusive (A/C) or well-chosen as to blend in (such as the bathroom fixtures). The beds are REALLY comfortable... The staff is polite, friendly and knowlegeable about the area. Nice common areas, I especially liked finding the small hidden spaces that are tucked away, like the small rooftop patio and the computer area.. The location couldn't be better. It's right off the main square, within walking distance to everything. We had a balcony room and the noise was somewhat of an issue, but I slept fine. The breakfast provided was OK (muffins, cookies, etc.), but there is a small old cafe across the street selling cheap breakfasts and awesome coffee- we ate there and enjoyed it a lot. I was travelling with my husband and another couple. All four of us were really impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Old-World Style Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: FramBrett
Reviews.Content: Hotel Belgica is a step back into a more languid time in Puerto Rico's past. Located around the corner from the stunning Plaza Delicitas, it's in an ideal location for exploring downtown Ponce. We found plenty of metered parking spaces on the street of the hotel (free on weekends, but make sure you feed the meter during the week, the meter maids are vigilant, as we learned the hard way). The hotel staff was helpful and pleasant. A light continental breakfast comes free with the room and is served in the charming lobby. Don't expect a big buffet; this is just coffee, juice, and a few baked goods. Note also that the lobby, hallways, and other public spaces in the hotel are not air-conditioned, as some of them are open to the outdoors. The room AC worked fine though, necessary at almost all times in this climate. The room was very clean and nicely furnished. The 12 foot ceilings and scrollwork door transoms in the guest rooms are clear evidence of the building's age and old-world stylings. We paid about $90 a night with tax for a room that was plenty large for three people. Considering you'd probably pay the same or more for a room in a bland chain hotel in a less convenient location, we think this was a good value. Ponce itself is a very interesting small city, a mix of grandeur and decay. If you're used to the cosmopolitan bustle of San Juan you may be disappointed. As a lover of architecture and history I enjoyed walking the streets and taking photos, while my wife thought there wasn't enough to do. Definitely head down to La Guancha, the boardwalk on the ocean a few miles south of downtown, for drinks and bar snacks at sunset. The beach there is not bad for a day of sunning and swimming either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/Very Charming”
Reviews.Author: meredss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I could not have asked for a better location. Within walking distance to shopping, cathedral, great restaurants, old fire station, etc. We got a great rate for a king bed, balcony, and amazing air conditioning. I have suggested Ponce and this hotel to friends and family who are avid travelers. Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Mi segunda casa.”
Reviews.Author: NAGUABOBROOKLYN
Reviews.Content: my family and i have been staying at this hotel since the owner humberto saavedra took over it in the lates 80,s let me tell you i have seen this place turn around in 190 degrees the owner has done a magnificient job in turning this place to what it is.this is not a 5 star hotel but if you are looking for a convinience,safe,clean and affordable hotel while in ponce then look no more this is the place.we have stay at all the hotels in the area of ponce and gayanilla as well and instead of paying over $150.00 a nite for a room elsewhere ill rather stay at the belgica,the hotel is close to everything around ponce and near towns we have no problem with parking we stay at room #19 ,9 and 12 and everything was very good from the people at the desk to the staff to the owner we have no complaints whats of ever clean rooms ,clean linen nice ac, continental breakfast ect,everything was perfect we cant wait to go back next year and stay there again because for the price you cant ask for more thats my opinion.on our last day in puerto rico we stayed at the embassy suites in san juan because my wife wanted to play the slot machines and let me tell you for what we pay for the nite at the embassy we could have stay 3 nites at the belgica we know it was in san juan but still a lot of money for one nites room..we know we all have good and bad experiences when traveling but ours allways been good at the belgica in ponce pr.thats why i call it,,mi segunda CASA..en ponce..

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean, charming rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Evergreen813
Reviews.Content: My favorite of the four hotels we stayed at. We had a charming room on the second floor with a balcony that faced the street. Unknown to us, we arrived in Ponce the night of the big Mardi gras celebration. The hotel is right in the middle of town and you can see and hear all the action. Great restaurants, museums, and cultural sights are all within walking distance. Room was spacious and very clean. The front desk was very friendly. Included breakfast was some fruit and bread and coffee--nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: bubbadad73
Reviews.Content: The Manager was extremely helpful in showing rooms and pricing, which are very affordable. The rooms were clean and comfortable, equipped with A/C and Satellite tv. There is a continental breakfast included; then we took the few steps to the plaza and watched people doing morning exercises! The hospitality @ Hotel Belgica was typical of the kind and helpful people of beautiful Ponce.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL AND COMFY PLACE-VERY FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: loquibori
Reviews.Content: My bf and I were overthere for vacation and a wedding. I booked this hotel since it was recommended by the groom. OMG when we got to this place it was wonderful. The room was extra clean, the a/c was great and a great view from our balcony. The only downside was that u can hear the cars and motorcycles passing by at night and the ongoing noise fromt he bar accross the street but other than that it is a great place to stay. We will be booking again when we go back to PR for a stay in Ponce. It is also centralized.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Sandracmcgrath
Reviews.Content: We initially planned on staying only 2 nights, but after doing Del Sur Adventures the morningwe checked out we decided heck let's stay a third night. Got to see two different rooms, no 6 and 18. Such a fab hotel, beautifully decorated - trying to keep all original features from the 1800's. So central, and reasonable prices (triple rooms $95 altogether).

Reviews.Title: “Great view of downtown Ponce”
Reviews.Author: LoveMonkey2821
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days in March 2011. It was everything you expected it to be. Clean rooms, friendly staff, great view on balcony (certain rooms only). It was located near center of town. We were in walking distance to most landmarks in downtown Ponce. We had the room with the balcony. Street noise goes right through the thin shutters, but it was not so bad. There is no parking lot for the hotel, so you will have to park on the street. During the day, traffic is very congested, but clears up at night with plenty of parking space. We will definately book this hotel when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Scary area”
Reviews.Author: llady2216
Reviews.Content: We cancelled our reservations after arriving in downtown Ponce. This area is in bad shape, mostly closed businesses, lots of grafiti, lots of police. I felt very unsafe and did not feet comfortable walking around the area in search of a meal. Parking was also a problem. The people at the Belgica were very kind and did not charge a cancellation fee.

Reviews.Title: “THE STAFF HAS KNOWLEDGE OF WHAT IS GOING ON”
Reviews.Author: melva7
Reviews.Content: I now can stop searching for a hotel in PONCE, I have found the best. Room clean friendly staff, great continental breakfast hotel very traditional, not just a common place LOVE IT CANNOT WAIT TO GO BACK

Reviews.Title: “Charming old hotel, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lagnafinc
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Belgica based on the reviews and the very reasonable price. Also based on the reviews, we requested a specific room (19) which had its own balcony right over the front entrance,on Calle Villa We were a little concerned about possible street noise on a Friday night....but the vast majority of noise is on the Plaza side where there can be loud music. I communicated with manager Humberto Saavedra for several months prior to our trip asking him all manner of questions about parking, restaurants, local sights...and in all cases he was most helpful, allowing us to arrive well-prepared for our short visit. Diana, the desk clerk, bent over backwards to help us when we arrived and through her simple advice helped us secure great parking right in front (free from 4:30PM Friday until Monday) Is this a Hilton or Sheraton polished within an inch of its life with sterile, soundproofed walls? ? No, it's not....and if that's what you're seeking and expecting, then don't go there. This is a charming old-world hotel in a great location with charming old world flaws and defects, and charming old world staff ready willing and able to help anyone with a pleasant attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean, and comfortable place in town”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Ex_camper
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient to the town square and is a perfect place to begin walking around Ponce. The town itself seems to be undergoing a renaissance and there are some quite good restaurants nearby. Our room was not large, but was not at all cramped and was attractive and well decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated w/love and care!”
Reviews.Author: lildrummer
Reviews.Content: Clean, neat, orginal, and done w/taste. The staff and owner reflect the caring attitude. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably best value in downtown Ponce”
Reviews.Author: ervine
Reviews.Content: Tired of traveling, tired of "industrial" tourism ? The Belgica's historic ambiance makes you feel right at home. Three caveats, though: 1- ultra-sensitive souls shoud not book one of the rooms to the front as they get some noise (especially) on weekend nights (or just join the fun). The other rooms should be fine. 2- unsuitable for handicapped persons as there is no elevator. 3- You may absolutely hate to leave this small amiable hotel and your friendly host, Humberto. Oh, and everybody will tell you to visit the Ponce Art Museum, so I will not repeat that, right ???!!??!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: LeionMan
Reviews.Content: Wonderful building, high celings, oldfashioned and cosy. Staff wonderful, the guy at the reception followed us to see if the car was parked at a safe place, gave us the choice between two rooms, and was very social over all. Quiet but central situation in town. Higly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Location were terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Cristina423
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here two nights. We had room 19. This a king bed room with a balcony. We stayed a Saturday and Sunday night, which gave us a range of activity in the streets. First off, the location is TERRIFIC!!! Right around the corner from the Plaza! Saturday night was a loud loud night with loud music and cars cruising down Calle Villa. Sunday was much better. The municipal band was playing right in front of City Hall and so that was a treat to view from the balcony. We had a difficult time trying to figure out how to work the AC, but it got cold and that's all we could ask for. Even if it did freeze us out in the middle of the night. Nothing fancy and the linens (sheets, towels, and comforters) could be updated. But the tall ceilings and the charm of the building make it all better! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, outstanding location.”
Reviews.Author: dmacica
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights in the Hotel Belgica as part of an 8 day trip driving around Puerto Rico. I was looking for a mix of beach time leisure and cultural enrichment. Ponce falls in the enrichment category, a beautiful an historic city with a classic central plaza, beautiful architecture, and fabulous food. Staying at the Belgica was part of that. The price is unbelievably low and it's directly around the corner from the plaza. To call it no frills is somewhat accurate, but fails to capture the charm of this 100 year old hotel and it's lovely lobby, rooms, and Spanish balconies hanging directly over Calle Villa. The staff was very friendly, allowing me to park on the street directly in front of the entrance, even though it was marked for drop offs. The rooms in the front (with the balconies) are the prettiest, but (as I was advised by the manager when making my reservation) could be noisy from the street. You see, the Belgica doesn't have windows, just wooden doors with shutters, so the sounds of the street are ever present. But, no matter: Earplugs helped me sleep, and the lively sounds of the city were part of the atmosphere the rest of the time. And it's not completely no frills: There's air conditioning, serviceable wi-fi, a small flat screen TV, and an updated tiled bathroom that supplied a nice hot shower when needed. A sign advises patience, as hot water is provided through a solar heater, so it takes a few minutes. It's like an eco-lodge in the middle of a 300 year old city! Highly recommended for the right kind of person.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Ponce”
Reviews.Author: EarlFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7 years ago and returned to find the hotel even better than we remembered. The owner added free public internet, satellite TV in every room and upgraded the rooms and bathrooms. What had NOT changed is its superb location right off the main plaza, the friendly and helpful owner and spotless facility, oozing with old world charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gabe7676
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really nice and very well decorated. We stayed in a room with a balcony, which tends to get noisy at night due to the cars passing by and a bar across the street. If you are a light sleeper, you will be better off in another room. If you like to go out at night or day, this hotel is located in the perfect place. All museums, Plaza Delicias, restaurants etc, are a couple of blocks away same with the bars and clubs at night. The hotel staff is very friendly and they will recommend you the places to visit. You can park your car right outside the hotel at night for free (street parking), but during weekdays you will need to pay starting at 8am or you will get a ticket. The breakfast was good, nothing fancy, but good enough to have your day started. if you are planning to go to the beach, Ponce is not the best place, but you can always drive an hour to Boqueron, which is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Ponce”
Reviews.Author: OHIOFrequentFlyers
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one day and night in Ponce with the help of the friendly staff at this conveniently located old hotel near the square. The rooms were of reasonable size, with small table and chairs, sink, ample shower, and bed. Ours had a balcony. We had access to the Internet, washer and dryer, refrigerator, and continental breakfast (along with the fixings for a peanut butter and jelly sandwich to pack) and fruit, all available in the pleasant public areas in the hotel. There is no elevator but I believe all the rooms are on the second floor. The friendly staff helped us find our way to the beautiful new Art Museum, with both Puerto Rican, Central American and European Art treasures, and recommended good restaurants. (We enjoyed the Argentinian cuisine the most).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: joe10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel on a recent trip and had a very enjoyable stay. It has a great location just off the square. You are within walking distance of key points of interest. We came out of odd hours of the night or early morning to enjoy some local activities at the spur of the moment. The room was so much bigger than we expected when we saw the building initially. High ceilings and super spacious. The structure is a bit dated but that was okay. The staff is very helpful. they have reasonable continental breakfast in the mornings. There is a room with Internet access via a PC which was very helpful. it does not have printer so when i need to print out a boarding pass, I simply walked over to Hotel Melia across the square and used theirs (be confident and walk to their room at the back :-)) Rooms with single beds have better views. Parking is offered at a public lot down the street. It is shared with the local Police so not as bad as it may sound. Quite safe and clean, with constant police patrols. For those who may note know the name means Belgium. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quaint hotel in center of Ponce”
Reviews.Author: bbeerbower
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an old hotel right in the center of town. We visited as they were getting the town ready the big Christmas festival. the hotel is located 1/2 block from the town's central plaza. The town itself was quaint and beautiful especially at night. The rooms were fairly large and clean. The shower was ok and the beds comfortable. the only negative was that there was no elevator nor restaurant. Parking was outside the hotel and if you didn't get a spot in front you had to drive to a public parking lot about a block away. The Staff was wonderful, friendly & helpful especially Joel. I would recommend this hotel again if you wanted to stay at a hotel in the center of Ponce. bbeerbower

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hkboxer
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. It is nothing fancy and very simple. The location is right in the center near the plaza where everything is. Near stores and restaurants. the room we stayed in was roomy and clean. It has a balcony with chairs where you can read and enjoy the sunset and the architecture around. The staff were really nice and gay friendly. They were really helpful and even helped us find a dentist. The only thing that might bother some is the noise from the street and the bar across the street that could get a little loud a night. If you are a light sleeper, maybe ask for a room away from the bars. It was ok for us since we only stayed there 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TheJTrain
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Belgica. The room was beautiful, the location can't be beaten (just steps off the square), and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There are some cons. The rooms in the front (especially #9) can get extremely noisy at night--the little bar across the street may not look like much, but it stays hopping and loud on the weekends. (We moved to an interior room that was much quieter.) Their dedicated parking is limited, but we never had trouble finding a spot on the street within a block. The wi-fi was spotty and actually nonexistent in one of the rooms we were in. These were all minor problems, though, and I'll definitely stay at the Belgica again when I make it back to Ponce.

Reviews.Title: “"sweet and old style"”
Reviews.Author: 101hotel
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband in one of the rooms with the balconies.... I loved the layout and style of the hotel and most of all the balcony. If you are tired of the modern look than this hotel is the perfect choice. Overall the staff was okay, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Anairene
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! The colonial look, the great service,convenient location and affordability...priceless! We'll be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, friendly and affordable”
Reviews.Author: spencersmom59
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Belgica and enjoyed the stay. The front desk staff is friendly and very accomodating. I recommend that you have a suitcase that you are prepared to carry up and down stairs because there is no elevator. This was not an issue for me, but other guests had overpacked cases they had trouble getting up the stairs. Be prepared for warm water and little shower pressure--the water is solar heated, so showers are hot late afternoon, but tepid any other time. Parking can be an issue, but there is a parking lot behind the Melia Hotel that has manned overnight parking for only $5. Yes, there is street noise, but remember that it is Puerto Rico and noise around a plaza is a given. Around the corner is a very popular club that gets very loud on weekends. If you get a chance, sit in the plaza and people watch. Lots of fun. We stayed in room 21. It appears to be a cupboard from the hall, but once you enter, it is a suprisingly large and pleasant room. Ponce is hardly a tourist destination, but it does have some pretty sites and fairly cheap eats. Right across the Belgica is a small cafe that serves delicious plate lunches and only a short walk away is a great bakery. The ice cream shop across the plaza is crazy good. A good sized portion was about $1.50. Try the parcha ice cream if you have a sweet tooth. I will stay at the Belgica whenever I need to return to southern Puerto Rico. It was very reasonably priced, very clean, and friendly. I am a frequent traveler and have seen some of the best hotels--Aria, Las Vegas--and some of the worst--Murphey's Lodge, Lee Vining, CA---tjhe Belgica is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Old Charm Appeal...so much to say..”
Reviews.Author: FranCarrollton
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent for more than 20 years, and having travelled extensively, I can say that this place is perfect for the seasoned traveler, who is looking for the "hotel that fits the place". . If you want to be entertained with shows, casino, or looking for a gym, tennis courts, pool, spa, etc. this is NOT your place. Go to the Ponce Hilton instead, and pay the big bucks for these amenities. If you appreciate the history and the architecture that encircles this historic city, and only want the basics, then go ahead and have a feast at the Belgica. My sister and I stayed for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. The owner did a great job trying to preserve the charm of this historic building and adding accordingly. Kudos to him. (I am sorry to say that I couldn't meet him, since I was on the run every day trying to absorb as much of the culture as possible, and attending to some planned events). The rooms have no telephone, no hair dryer, or iron, and yes, it can get noisy at times. I travel with ear plugs for this reason, so be ready and take yours. At this hotel , you are in the city, so expect noise! The beds were comfortable, the room and bathroom were clean. You will have a fridge, Tv, and place to hang your clothes, but no closet. You can't have everything in life, and a good traveler adapts. The staff was helpful and nice. Much better than at many other places I have stayed in the states, and in several countries in Europe. They are just simple hard working people who wants to be hospitable.. Do not expect a buffet breakfast either. It's very simple, just to get you going. The coffee could be better though. Suggestion to management: Puerto Rico has great coffee, and if you serve good coffee, you can help the economy by telling them what coffee you're serving.. the hotel can even sell it! Just charge it to the room! There's no elevator, true, but the staff is willing to help out with luggage. I have a herniated disk and was helped. Also, be aware that parking is limited. We had trouble on Saturday night, when the lounges and bars are crowded. Parking is limited at any time of the day around the square, anyways. Avoid parking in dark areas, of course. On Sunday, July 13th, there was a Santeros Fair, and unfortunately we couldn't stay but a lot of this art was offered, along with typical music. Make sure to have some of the ice cream at King's Cream by the Melia Hotel. Visit the cathedral and the historic Casa Poventud. Admire the old building that housed the Banco Popular and visit the City Hall. You will find souvenir stores but be aware that less then half of the merchandise is locally made. On a sad note, I was heartbroken to see so many historic houses/ mansions that have been abandoned or vandalized in the area. I can't believe the government have allowed this to happen. Isn't there anyone interested in saving these gems of history? A lot can be said about the people who throws away their own history. People of Ponce, please do something!!! If you need more info, and if I can help, you can contact me via email..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, very charming and cozy place for the buck,, loved it...”
Reviews.Author: edaris
Reviews.Content: I got here about 3:30am on 6/5/10 to find a very friendly and courteous staff and very helpfull, specially at that time in the morning. (I would be grumpy if you ask me) but no, that set the perfect mood for our staying visit, I had not been to Puerto RIco in over 10yrs and was very pleasantly surprised when I got there, (I'm from Guayanilla,next town over) and I was reluctantly expecting a diferrent welcome and was some what prepared for that, but no, The staff could not be better.; always helpful and making sure that all was perfect. The hotel has this old world style charm that some how reminds you of the old time movies of yesterday, but with a touch of modern times. I'm already making plans for next year, this is the place I will be staying again. You have everything at your finger tips, places to see, eat and shop. Not far from any turistic site and yet able to find other places. You should try a walk in the plaza in the evening, sitting down on the benches while savoring the local natural ice cream across the plaza in front of the old firehouse, delicious and refreshing, and yet a few steps from the Hotel. only negative thought was the lack of parking for the hotel guest (very few spots in front) but easy to get to start your day, in house room phones could be a plus., but other than that, I would recomend this Hotel to anyone of my friends planning to stay in Ponce anytime or anyone else for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Clean, Clean!”
Reviews.Author: JanetteCarrasquillo
Reviews.Content: If you look for cleanliness, this is the hotel you are looking for. It's beautiful and clean. As soon as we got there, we felt good. The staff is very, very nice. And the room was really, really clean, I mean it. Not a spot. Big, comfortable beds and pillows. My kids were very happy. As it is located almost in front of the "plaza", we walked around, we ate, we saw the stores, and we took a trip in the touristic bus, without having to move the car. The water was warm, mmm. The breakfast was included, very healthy. The only complaint my kids have is that they wanted to watch TV but the Channels were limited, only five or six, only one for them. But, for everything else, we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay - Old world”
Reviews.Author: confam
Reviews.Content: This would get 5 stars if it was not on a busy loud street. It was beautiful. We stayed at 5 hotels and this was the best one. Would have loved to stay for a week. Great little restaurant across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming old word hotel, true to Ponce's history”
Reviews.Author: vasalloeric
Reviews.Content: A very historic old world hotel in the heart of ponce, steps from the main plaza, historic trolley and museums. Staff were wonderful, owner gushes and obviously loves his hometown and his hotel. Very nice experience overall. Room 29 overlooking plaza with charming french style balcony was very comfy. (king size bed). overall much better than spending 120- per night around the corner at sterilized modern hotel with no historic feel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place”
Reviews.Author: meefeng
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. We stayed in Puerto Rico for 1 extra night after our wonderful cruise. I had to say, besides of Old San Juan and this hotel, nothing else we would recommend in PR. We had bad experience with locals ripping us off. But this hotel, oh, this hotel was so full of characters. The room height had to be at least 15 feet. The doors antique like and ~10feet tall. The place was clean. The staff nice. The rest of the hotel reminded me so much of the place i stayed in Venice, Italy. Nice memory. The price was $90 for 1 room. we stayed at room 19 which had 2 doors to the balcony. It was a bit noisy b/c it was right by the street. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. Not much in Ponce tho.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and charming, but could have used a window”
Reviews.Author: intrepid42
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful when we called for driving directions. Our room was small but cozy and architecturally interesting. We thought the room could have used a window, but later discovered that many urban hotel rooms in PR don't have windows. Belgica is an affordable choice for downtown Ponce.

Reviews.Title: “Great old hotel right on the main square - great staff!”
Reviews.Author: CtFreddie
Reviews.Content: I had a rear room which was very quiet - high ceilings, huge bathroom, comfy bed. Loved the old time charm. Fridge available on rear balcony. Wi-fi didn't work in room, but available down the hall at near public use computer. The desk staff were very helpful & spoke excellent English. Free garage parking four blocks away. Lots of nice restaurants nearby. A great base for exploring the south coast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: JustinS6
Reviews.Content: A very affordable and charming little hotel. There are not many amenities, but the architecture alone is worth the stay.. absolutely stunning, over 500 years old! The price was excellent as well.. we paid $85 for a room with exclusive access to the Spanish-style balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Its the personal touch and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jeff17Ireland
Reviews.Content: Had a great time ,staff very helpful and the Hotel is ideally positioned . Great value for money :) Belgica has lots of charm and I would recommend to friends and family . Liked the use of solar to heat water :) and rooms were really something. Also right next to taxi rank .. :))) 24 hour front desk ....:) ...I stayed 15 nights and wished I could have stayed longer...Jeff

Reviews.Title: “Ponce Needs Some Better Tourist Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Zephyr-TA
Reviews.Content: The Belgica... what a trip! We had front room on the street which was clean and the ac was amazingly capable considering the lack of glass windows, instead old wood shutters on a narrow balcony. It was their Christmas celebration on the square (several doors away) and for two nights the noise was deafening (we were told only to get worse on the weekend), and still evident from the discos until 4 am. On the second morning at 5 am, someone dropped a string of M80's in the street which reverberated throughout the square. The previous evenings were accompanied by a huge police presence. This is their government square and back here we'd call it disturbing the peace. The cannon fire was shortly followed (5+ am) by a sound truck going up and down the streets with blaring music. We could not wait to escape town and thankfully, the car had not been blown up. The hotel... we were fortunate in having a very helpful desk clerk who invited us to use the parking meter fund the next morning and gave us good advice on where to eat (Cafe Thomas about two blocks away). We could not locate the "underground parking" and spent some time moving the car around in the street (remember it was a huge celebration going on!) The clerk that evening could speak no English. An arrival that night would have been more difficult. It's 28 long steps up to the rooms, no elevator, no help. We had lots of baggage. That was back breaking. Continental breakfast was passable and that's all, but for the room price, you can't expect more. I searched for accomodations from Cabo Rojo to Ponce and could find nothing affordable and consistently good. One place had a review saying "a long drive for breakfast..." no thanks. So, they need better hotels and more tourists. Until then, be prepared for the problem stays. The Belgica is a treat if basic is your style, and quite a street scene across the street... another reason I am reluctant to recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “do not paid in advance”
Reviews.Author: dragon61
Reviews.Content: The lady mgr. after 9 days moved me to smaller room for only one day.next day I ask her to put me back in the regular room. her answer was no and she did not make my reservation. and told me to speak to the owner. which I did agreed gave me credit for only one night. The same day I was forced to stay at a smaller room, at one A.M the electricity went out in the room there were no electrician available so I had to leave the hotel. my tel [--]

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, very good service, great price.”
Reviews.Author: Matapasiones1
Reviews.Content: Small room, but fine for a night or two, and if you're gonna be out going around most of you stay.. Great service; very friendly.. Great loation. Beautiful structure. Quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Historical and classy!”
Reviews.Author: ShePR-HimMX
Reviews.Content: We have stayed all over the island of Puerto Rico and have to say that this is the best place to stay while in Ponce. It was very clean and the hospitality was amazing. This hotel had a very nostalgic feel to it, almost like being in an old Hollywood movie. It is also very accessible to the main plaza in Ponce. Close to all the shops. I would also suggest visiting a store called "Mi Coqui" . They have everything Puerto Rican. My wife and I traveled all over the island, literally, staying in other places and found great comfort in staying at the Hotel Belgica.

Reviews.Title: “Way more than we expected, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: LunaTx
Reviews.Content: I can only describe Hotel Belgica as an unexpected surprise, a B&B feel but with a lot more energy. The room was quite large and comfortable, very clean and with all the amenities. Lively area with great restaurants, shops and sight seeing. The staff was amazing, went above and beyond. Thanks to Joel, Eda, Diana, Daisy and of course Humberto. I wish you all the best and I hope to visit again soon. Greetings from TEXAS!!! CSTMOON

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: jim062SantaFe_Nm
Reviews.Content: I've visited Puerto Rico/Ponce four times in the past 18 months, and I won't stay anywhere else the next time I go. Ponce itself, first of all, is a natural home base for exploring the southern coast of the island. The Belgica is right in the center of the old town, he Plaza a block away. Rooms are clean and comfortable and a bargain. I found the staff to be attentive and helpful; most speak English. If you want the lights, noise and distractions of big city life, go to San Juan. Ponce is on a human scale, great for walking around, with several attractions no more than 15 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location..get a room with balcony or window!”
Reviews.Author: Soon2Hawaii
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of character to it. Its very historic, well maintained and nicely decorated. The staff was nice. The room was very spacious and dark! We didn't get a window or balcony and the room did not have a clock so we never knew what time of day it was. Water never got hot but warm yes. No phone in room. No iron in room but you can borrow one at front desk. No elevators and parking can be difficult at times. We never walked to the parking lot they suggested since we were getting to hotel after 11 PM. We enjoyed the location in the center of Ponce but we were surprised by the lack of places to have a nice breakfast. I recommend making sure there are no festivals during your reservations since the traffic will get really bad! Location is what really sets apart this hotel from other affordable options in Ponce. You can't do better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, historic small hotel-the second best thing in Ponce”
Reviews.Author: boldadventurer
Reviews.Content: The only other reason to go to Ponce is the plaza's antique fire station. I am living for a yea in Puerto Rico, and when my son came to visit, took him to Ponce. The only thing worth seeing in the town is the antique fire station with a walk around the plaza, so I chose the Belgica hotel. We loved its location and the staff was pleasant and helpful--We would stay there happily again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location, nicely appointed, historic and shockingly affordable.”
Reviews.Author: jahausa
Reviews.Content: The Belgica was steps to the central square in Ponce. The hotel is in an architecturally notable building. It had a nice sense of history and a very local feeling. Our room was huge, with a king sized bed and access to a long balcony. I could not believe how low the prices were to stay here. Pros: - Location cannot be beat. - Prices were too good to believe. - Huge room. - Breakfast was pretty plain, juices, donuts and bread. But serviceable. Cons: - Parking was sketchy, since down the road a couple blocks the neighborhood was not nice. In fact, a lot of Ponce was very sadly rundown, although it was clean and seemed like it oozed potential - Bedding was a bit tired. - BRING YOUR RESERVATION CONFIRMATION PRINTED OUT. I read other reviews talking about lost reservations. Mine was "lost" as well, which was pretty odd since when I showed them my printout they produced the room very quickly. Not sure what's up with this, but this is the lone reason this place did not get a 4 of 5 rating from me.

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation”
Reviews.Author: RussinMaine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights in February 2009 at the Belgica and were very satisfied. We rarely spend that much time in one spot but we were enchanted with Ponce and the old hotel, which is a former mansion. The rate was very much a bargain. Our room balcony overlooked the street and we enjoyed the views, and watching the people pass by. The furnishings are okay but not luxurious. There is no elevator but the walk up one flight was good for us. Beware a balcony room on Friday night because the night club across the street blasts loud music until the wee hours. We used earplugs. Staff is friendly and helpful. Didn't care for the free breakfast but there are inexpensive cafeterias within a few minutes walk. You can park free on the street at night, and in a garage two blocks away during the day. Ponce has a lot to offer -- it is very laid back, and not a touristy place. You get to meet the locals, many of whom speak English. Take a tour, which costs only four dollars. Sights to see include the nearby Plaza de las Delicias and the city museum, if you are interested in local history. We took many great photos. We'd like to return some day. Russ in Maine

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room with a balcony...”
Reviews.Author: Micki537
Reviews.Content: If you stay here, definitely ask for a room with a balcony. We stayed in Room 19, which was really nice. Everything was very clean, there was a nice king-size bed. We wanted to use the internet while we were here, but had some problems and the staff was not very helpful, but other than that, the staff was quite nice. The hotel doesn't have a parking lot. You have to park on the street, but there are a few free parking spaces right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you have a quiet room!!!”
Reviews.Author: bluetigereyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ponce at Hotel Belgica the first weekend in March. We had reserved room 10, a front balcony room. It was beautiful, charming, spacious, really fabulous but we were unable to sleep the entire nite. The small bar across the way was active until 3 or 4 am as were its patrons cavorting and screaming in the street. When we arrived at the hotel that Friday afternoon the very helpful desk person warned us that this might be a problem but there were no rooms vacant to move to. They were extremely helpful in changing our room for the next two nites after our sleepless nite. However, the room we moved to, #5, was right off the generator area and all nite intermittently (more on than off) we heard that very loud noise. So, steer clear of rooms on the street during weekends or festivals and ask specifically for a quiet room that is not near machine noise or the back veranda where guests go to smoke and chat. Otherwise, this is truly a sweet well located hotel, just near the plaza and in the heart of the wonderful ambience of historic Ponce (which is defintely worth a visit).

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, right off main square, vaulted cieling rooms”
Reviews.Author: eschuber
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff will give you tips on the city. Not much to do in square, but drive south on 12 to guanacha(?) park for great salsa dancing outdoors/informal most evenings. Hotel is quaint with large rooms with elegant windows/doors. Definitely get a room with a balcony, it's cool! The place to stay in Ponce. I didn't see any museums in Ponce but it may be of interest as there is not much on the central plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good value, enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: PalmettoGuesthouse
Reviews.Content: As owners of a Guesthouse on Culebra island, Puerto Rico, ourselves, we realize the effort that goes into maintaining a quality business. We arrived prior to the check in time, however the friendly woman at the front desk checked on our room for us & finding that it was ready, we were able to get right in. Her being so accomodating was extra helpful as we were running late for a 1/2 marathon race in a nearby town. She even invited us to partake in their free continental b-fast (fruits, oatmeal cookies, juice & coffee-a nice touch & FREE). The room (& lobby/hall areas) was well appointed, the beds were comfortable, the a/c worked fine, & the bathroomn was clean with a spiffy, modern sink. I wish that we could have spent another relaxing evening at the Belgica.

Reviews.Title: “Confirm Reservation”
Reviews.Author: Luis T
Reviews.Content: I am from Ponce and am familiar with the hotels in the plaza area. Belgica is one of the oldest, a quaint hotel with an old world type charm. My problems stem from the reservation via the desk clerk at the time. Essentially, she booked the wrong day, I was charged and had nowhere to stay. I had the credit card company reverse the charges, but then the manager wrote a letter in dispute with falsified dates and the charges were put through. There are other places in Ponce with modern amenities that one would favor. Tthe only reason for booking @Belgica - was to give my fiancee a whimsical look at Ponce and that fell through. If you're not booking via a website, please save yourself some aggravation. Luis.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy about the Hotel Belgica”
Reviews.Author: prettygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Belgica for 3 nights during a business/vacation trip to Ponce. The personnel at the hotel is very warm and friendly (like family)...especially Maria (the daytime clerk) while we were there. She was helpful in recommending restaurants, give us directions to other towns and took the time to share some of the culture of Ponce. The hotel is OK for a short stay (no pool). However, if you are looking for a clean room with a great view of the town, this is the hotel for you. You cannot beat the price per night and they also offer a continental breakfast. There are several other cafes and resturants for full breakfasts and also lunch and dinner. We will be returning to Ponce very shortly and will again stay at the Belgica. Oh, by the way, if you are a couple, ask for room #19...it has a balconey and a wonderful view of the city. Can be a little noisey if you are a light sleeper. However, it is worth it...spacious room, modern bath and great bed!!

Reviews.Title: “Central historic location”
Reviews.Author: vegalegarreta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near to everything in central historic Ponce. It's an ecconomical staying place. Nice and friendly staff. Comfortable rooms and well preserved building. Not a fancy hotel, but really cozy. The only thing that I didn't like was: no parkin or reserved parking lots..

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss this one.”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy1125
Reviews.Content: Went to visit historic Ponce just this week. First the only problem with Ponce is that all the highways are doing construction. Once you find the Hotel Belgica it will be worth all the wait. You walk into this historic old building in literally the center of ponce. Dont stay at this hotel if you are looking for the most up to date services. Rooms dont have phones, there is no pool, and there is no elevator. This hotel is truly for people who like old world charm at very cheap prices. Emma and Joel are great and they will give you detailed maps of what to do. Beware though that typical spanish restaurants close very early so make sure you eat a big lunch. My personal recommendation is the restaurant literally across the street. Dont remember the name but its the only thing across the street. Enjoy Ponce

Reviews.Title: “Nice place near all”
Reviews.Author: IJK01
Reviews.Content: Found the place as reviewed. An older, adequately maintained property that is within 20 yds of Ponce's main square. No elevator so you will be carrying your own bags up marble staircases. Take an inner room as it is quieter, but each floor has a common veranda which you can use at will. Friendly. helpful staff who allowed us to park right in front of the hotel rather than have to use the public parking lot which is a few blocks away. NB it is in a night life area so you may not be able to park directly on the street the hotel is located on if you try to park on a weekend night. However there is plenty of street parking nearby and within walking distance. Also if you visit the City's tourist office located in the old firehouse on the square before you register, you will get a discount booklet which, when we visited, had a coupon from the hotel with a 3 nights for the price of two deal. All in all a good value.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous hotel - only one problem”
Reviews.Author: eagle2435
Reviews.Content: We really loved most everything about Hotel Belgica - the service, staff, room, and location was great. The rooms are so nicely decorated and spacious - our favorite room of our 10 day trip to Puerto Rico. Its right outside the City Square where all the shops are and some good restaurants nearby. We got a great deal, $75 a night for a spacious King room with a nice balcony. The only problem we had - we stayed here on a weekend (political primary weekend at that) and the kids were noisy. There were your usual young kids driving by and playing music loudly and a lot of kids yelling and screaming outside til about 3 am, and we could hear it all. I don't know if it is always like this, but it is something I would check on with the hotel, because there was a lot of noise. All in all, we had a great stay though.

Reviews.Title: “so many hassles so little time”
Reviews.Author: SouthCarolinaMax
Reviews.Content: arrived 4 a.m. after being completely lost in a downtown full of torn up streets, no street signs, hopelessly incorrect maps through help of a good samaritan. I had called and reserved for that time but no room! After some discussion (in Spanish with night man) I walked around the area but nothing available. Went back, told him I would sleep in car and then expect room in the morning. Suddenly a room was available (but only for a few hours), OK by me. In morning they moved me to a room with a wall AC that was so loud I couldn't even hear the TV. Finally the second night I complained and was moved to a room with cardboard walls and smell of cigarette smoke from next room. They did not charge for the first night and I thanked them for that, but then they wanted each night paid....no paying at check out! Freezer outside in dark to get your ice, chip it out of a block. Park your car a few blocks away or hope to find a place on the street. No internet connections, a coffee pot and some cookies on the counter for "continental breakfast". It was a traditional old hotel, kept very clean which was about the only positive thing I can think of. I thought for the price it was a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel. nice room, very noisy outdoors”
Reviews.Author: hair_2_play
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at the Belgica. We were really looking forward to our stay because we finally found something we really needed for an good night's sleep: a king size bed! The hotel is in the heart of Ponce and has a old world charm about it. Its very pretty on the outside and the interior is definitely from another century. The room was spacious with high ceilings and a balcony that overlooks the street. We were happy so far but things began to go downhill pretty fast. The biggest draw of the hotel is also (in our opinion) its biggest drawback: its location. Its hard to get a good night's sleep because of all the street noise at night. The room doesnt have sealed doors/windows, so all the street noise makes it way up. To make things worse, we stayed there on a Saturday night and there was a Christmas concert in the town square bang outside the hotel. The concert ended at 11 but the noise didn't! The street cleaning crew was even louder than the actual concert. We managed to get no more than an hour of sleep. The air conditioner doesnt have a temperature control so were both ended up with a cold. And 'continental breakfast' is a joke: luke warm coffee and cookies! Thank God for the Burger King next door. I would recommend this place if you want to be in the heart of Ponce but not if you want some rest and a good night's sleep. This is really sad because the hotel is really pretty and has a lot of potential.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: enneagram9
Reviews.Content: Location right off town square. Lovely old style rooms with modern bath. Nice balcony on street. Staff gave excellent directions especially considering road work, etc. going on at the time. Also, staff was helpful in recommending places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grizinator
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for those who want a convinient location at an affordable price. The rooms were spacious, clean and an extremely friendly and helpful staff. We had a balcony room, but noise was not a problem (even though it was Christmas time, which means lots of activity in the square and on the streets below) and I am even somewhat of a light sleeper. The interior rooms are quieter but you will not enjoy the big balcony. We did park on the street (3 blocks away) but anyone travelling in Puerto Rico (especially those who live there) should know that parking is at a primium in the cities and you will have to either pay through the nose for parking or walk a few blocks (the blocks are short and the walk will do you good!). There is space to load and unload your luggage during check in, so there is no need to walk 3 blocks with your bags. All in all a wonderful experience and we'd highly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very affordable and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SLIMFLAQUITA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ponce for the weekend, and this was the most affordable hotel I could find. Although the hotel was a little hard to find, due to the million one-way streets, it was very enjoyable. The hotel room was very clean, and the A/C worked perfectly. However, I did have to go the reception desk to request washcloths, as that seemed to be a rarity there. The rooms were unusually small, and the TV did not have cable at all. But you get what you pay for. All-in-all, I had a great experience, and the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. For the money, I would definitely stay there again. Although, I would bring a dvd player to watch movies.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chlie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had booked a room in Cabo Rojo. The room proved to be the biggest mistake of our vacation. We did try to tough it out there, but decided during our sleepless night that we would be leaving in the morning. We were determined to find a place to stay and made our way to Ponce. We were lucky to have found Hotel Belgica. It is in the heart of Ponce and offers very convenient access to the beautiful attractions that Ponce has to offer. We chose a windowless room on the advice of one of the employees to avoid the noise of the nightlife. The room was very clean and the staff was very polite and helpful in getting around the town. We will definitely keep Hotel Belgica in mind on our next trip to Puerto Rico. A good tip before you decide to do ANYTHING. Take the trolley tour for $2.00 offered at the Fire House. With the tour, you get a coupon book with tons of great offers. We visited the Museum de Ponce BEFORE we took the tour. The coupon book had a nice discount for visiting the museum. Not only do you get the savings book, the tour itself is more than worth the price of admission. The tour is given in both Spanish and English. The trolley stops at a sports museum, observes one of the oldest and biggest trees in Ponce, and stops at a Cemetery which has been converted into a museum due to its historical significance. One trip on the trolley does not do it justice. It is a must see attraction on any vacation to Ponce.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable hotel with more charm than Ponce itself”
Reviews.Author: babylovestravel
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a king sized bed and a balcony, which was a bit noisy at night with the traffic below. However, the room was large and nicely furnished. The high ceilings and original details were lovely. The bathroom seemed recently renovated and spotlessly clean. The bed was comfortable, lighting pleasant, a/c quiet and effective. I highly recommend the hotel, but not Ponce. The Lonely Planet guidebook we had was very misleading. We planned two nights there, but left after one. There was only one restaurant open for dinner. We walked and walked looking for someplace to eat breakfast, and the only place we could find was a food counter in a store. The center square was mostly deserted except for a few drunks, and was mostly just bare dirt around the trees. Only a couple of the buildings around it were nice. All in all, Ponce had a depressed and deserted feeling to it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maelaisintown
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at the Belgica for one night, should I say nightmare. First, I was told by the hotel that they have a parking area wich is the street!!!!!! On the night that I arrived at the hotel, there was a sort of festival at the square so there was no space on the street to leave my car. They could not care less and advised me on leave the car somewhere in town and that meant 3 blocks away that a I had to walk back with my lugages because there where no personell at the hotel to help me. While I was doing that and when I arrived at the hotel, I was told that they could "not find" my reservation. It was late so I had to beg to the employee to make a new one and give me a room. The room was clean. Next day I checked out. Two weeks later I got two charges on my credit card, the one that I used and the one they found. I am puertorrican and I live in this island and I dont think that anyone deserves this kind of service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendy and Unique”
Reviews.Author: ILfemale
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Belgica during my first trip to Puerto Rico last month. The Hotel was hard to locate based on the on-line directions we were given, but once we found it we were relieved to have a pleasant stay. The staff is very friendly, and eager to learn more English from mainland US natives. They asked us to park in a spot on the street where they could keep an eye on our car, and gave us an extra mattress for a member of our party without extra charge. Both the lobby and rooms have lots of character and charm. The lobby is covered on all sides with large ornate mirrors, and the very high ceilings in the rooms make the rooms almost as high as they are wide. The rooms opening to the front balconies do not have windows -- but that is ok; it makes it easier to sleep in without the morning light peaking through. I did see one roach in the bathroom, but had no other cleanliness issues with this hotel. We were even given washcloths upon request -- a rarity in Puerto Rico, we found!

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, with balcony”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinVagabond
Reviews.Content: Charming, Spanish colonial hotel with tile floors and high ceilings, 1/2 block off of the town square. We followed Frommer's advice and requested room 8, 9, or 10, all of which have access to the balcony across the front of the building. We had a $65 reservation. The balcony rooms are normally $75, but they let us have one for $65 due to low occupancy that night. Our stay was Dec. 7, 2005. The balcony was nice, but it is shared with the other two rooms, so we didn't leave the shutter doors open at night. Also, being over the street, we were awakened by late-night revelers down below at 3AM - so the balcony rooms are a mixed blessing. Hotel was clean - receptionist was nice. Breakfast was just doughnut holes and coffee. Overnight parking was allowed on the street out in front. We initially requested the reservation via email, with no response to follow-ups in English or Spanish. We finally verified the reservation after several phone calls in Spanish. We gave them a credit card number, which was charged in full immediately. We would stay here again. FYI - There are free Internet computers at the Historic Archive office, across the plaza from the Belgica (#8 on their city tourist map). Also, do not eat at the full-service restaurant in the marina at the La Guancha boardwalk - bad service, bad food.

Reviews.Title: “Woderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say how much we enjoyed our short stay at Belgica. What a beautiful hotel, including excellent service! I will recommend it highly to all future Ponce visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Calm and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This nice hotel sort of made up for how dead Ponce was on a Sunday afternoon. It was clean, there was hot water in the nice bathroom, the airconditioner was great. We had a balcony room but since we were running the airconditioner we couldn't keep the doors open of course! So, no windows. But it's a nice non-touristy place.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it”
Reviews.Author: TejasJuez
Reviews.Content: Half the rooms have no windows. We wanted to stay at this hotel because of the description of the balconies. We were put in rooms with no windows. One room had no key to the door, so everytime we returned, we had to have someone go up with the master key. We switched to a room with a balcony and it had no glass in the windowpane. It was just a wooden door to the outside balcony. Spend your money someplace else.
